text: Alapayevsk () is a town in Sverdlovsk Oblast, Russia. It is at the confluence of the Neyva and Alapaikha rivers. Population: 44,263 (2002 census); 50,060 (1989 census). == History == The town was founded in 1781. === Murder of Russian Imperial family members === On July 18, 1918, the day after the shooting of the last tsar Nicholas II and his family, other members of the Romanov family were thrown down a mineshaft near Alapayevsk by the Bolsheviks. == References == == Other websites == * Official website of Alapayevsk * Directory of organizations in Alapayevsk Category:Cities and towns in Sverdlovsk Oblast
title: Alapayevsk
